channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Spatio-temporal collaborative multiple-stream transformer network for liver lesion classification on multiple-sequence magnetic resonance imaging
item.description: Accurate identification of focal liver lesions is essential for determining the appropriate therapeutic approach in clinical practice.

item.title: Data Valuation using Neural Networks for Efficient Instruction Fine-Tuning
item.description: Particularly, recent works have proposed various metrics and algorithms to calculate the influence of data using language models, which do not scale well with large models and datasets.

item.title: CISSIR: Beam Codebooks with Self-Interference Reduction Guarantees for Integrated Sensing and Communication Beyond 5G
item.description: We propose a beam codebook design to reduce self-interference (SI) in integrated sensing and communication (ISAC) systems.

item.title: Comparative Study of Machine Unlearning Techniques for Computer Vision and NLP Models
item.description: Machine unlearning is an emerging field in machine learning that focuses on efficiently removing the influence of specific data from a trained model.

item.title: Robust Anomaly Detection via Tensor Chidori Pseudoskeleton Decomposition
item.description: The results underscore the potential of Tensor Chidori pseudoskeleton decomposition to enhance anomaly detection for large-scale, high-dimensional data.

item.title: QMaxViT-Unet+: A Query-Based MaxViT-Unet with Edge Enhancement for Scribble-Supervised Segmentation of Medical Images
item.description: Building on this approach, we propose QMaxViT-Unet+, a novel framework for scribble-supervised medical image segmentation.

item.title: Evaluating the Performance of TAAF for image classification models
item.description: In this paper, we present the results of testing a custom activation function, The Analog Activation Function (TAAF), on both the MNIST and CIFAR-10 datasets.

item.title: A Judge-free LLM Open-ended Generation Benchmark Based on the Distributional Hypothesis
item.description: Evaluating the open-ended text generation of large language models (LLMs) is challenging because of the lack of a clear ground truth and the high cost of human or LLM-based assessments.

item.title: SQuARE: Sequential Question Answering Reasoning Engine for Enhanced Chain-of-Thought in Large Language Models
item.description: In the rapidly evolving field of Natural Language Processing, Large Language Models (LLMs) are tasked with increasingly complex reasoning challenges.

item.title: CopySpec: Accelerating LLMs with Speculative Copy-and-Paste Without Compromising Quality
item.description: We introduce CopySpec, an innovative technique designed to tackle the inefficiencies LLMs face when generating responses that closely resemble previous outputs.

item.title: Improving Deep Regression with Tightness
item.description: For deep regression, preserving the ordinality of the targets with respect to the feature representation improves performance across various tasks.

item.title: Wholly-WOOD: Wholly Leveraging Diversified-quality Labels for Weakly-supervised Oriented Object Detection
item.description: Accurately estimating the orientation of visual objects with compact rotated bounding boxes (RBoxes) has become a prominent demand, which challenges existing object detection paradigms that only use horizontal bounding boxes (HBoxes).

item.title: This looks like what? Challenges and Future Research Directions for Part-Prototype Models
item.description: The growing interest in eXplainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) has prompted research into models with built-in interpretability, the most prominent of which are part-prototype models.

item.title: SigGate: Enhancing Recurrent Neural Networks with Signature-Based Gating Mechanisms
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach that enhances recurrent neural networks (RNNs) by incorporating path signatures into their gating mechanisms.

item.title: Pixel-Level Reasoning Segmentation via Multi-turn Conversations
item.description: To establish a benchmark for this novel task, we build a Pixel-level ReasonIng Segmentation Dataset Based on Multi-Turn Conversations (PRIST), comprising 24k utterances from 8. 3k multi-turn conversational scenarios with segmentation targets.

item.title: PTZ-Calib: Robust Pan-Tilt-Zoom Camera Calibration
item.description: In this paper, we present PTZ-Calib, a robust two-stage PTZ camera calibration method, that efficiently and accurately estimates camera parameters for arbitrary viewpoints.

item.title: Vision-Language In-Context Learning Driven Few-Shot Visual Inspection Model
item.description: We propose general visual inspection model using Vision-Language Model~(VLM) with few-shot images of non-defective or defective products, along with explanatory texts that serve as inspection criteria.

item.title: AnomalyGFM: Graph Foundation Model for Zero/Few-shot Anomaly Detection
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose AnomalyGFM, a GAD-oriented graph foundation model that supports zero-shot inference and few-shot prompt tuning for GAD in diverse graph datasets.

item.title: Bridging Jensen Gap for Max-Min Group Fairness Optimization in Recommendation
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we first theoretically demonstrate that the MMF-constrained objective can be essentially reformulated as a group-weighted optimization objective.

item.title: Use of Air Quality Sensor Network Data for Real-time Pollution-Aware POI Suggestion
item.description: This demo paper presents AirSense-R, a privacy-preserving mobile application that provides real-time, pollution-aware recommendations for points of interest (POIs) in urban environments.

item.title: Communicating Likelihoods with Normalising Flows
item.description: We present a machine-learning-based workflow to model an unbinned likelihood from its samples.

item.title: Eidetic Learning: an Efficient and Provable Solution to Catastrophic Forgetting
item.description: We show with a variety of network architectures and sets of tasks that EideticNets are immune to forgetting.

item.title: Unlocking the Potential of Classic GNNs for Graph-level Tasks: Simple Architectures Meet Excellence
item.description: Message-passing Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are often criticized for their limited expressiveness, issues like over-smoothing and over-squashing, and challenges in capturing long-range dependencies, while Graph Transformers (GTs) are considered superior due to their global attention mechanisms.

item.title: The Stochastic Parrot on LLM's Shoulder: A Summative Assessment of Physical Concept Understanding
item.description: In a systematic way, we investigate a widely asked question: Do LLMs really understand what they say?, which relates to the more familiar term Stochastic Parrot.

item.title: LP-LM: No Hallucinations in Question Answering with Logic Programming
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are able to generate human-like responses to user queries.

item.title: Diffusion Models for Molecules: A Survey of Methods and Tasks
item.description: This survey aims to facilitate understanding and further flourishing development in this area.

item.title: Learning to Coordinate with Experts
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a fundamental coordination problem called Learning to Yield and Request Control (YRC), where the objective is to learn a strategy that determines when to act autonomously and when to seek expert assistance.

item.title: LiSA: Leveraging Link Recommender to Attack Graph Neural Networks via Subgraph Injection
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have demonstrated remarkable proficiency in modeling data with graph structures, yet recent research reveals their susceptibility to adversarial attacks.

item.title: DiffMS: Diffusion Generation of Molecules Conditioned on Mass Spectra
item.description: Extensive experiments on established benchmarks show that DiffMS outperforms existing models on $\textit{de novo}$ molecule generation.

item.title: Package Bids in Combinatorial Electricity Auctions: Selection, Welfare Losses, and Alternatives
item.description: A key challenge in combinatorial auctions is designing bid formats that accurately capture agents' preferences while remaining computationally feasible.

item.title: Reevaluating Policy Gradient Methods for Imperfect-Information Games
item.description: In the past decade, motivated by the putative failure of naive self-play deep reinforcement learning (DRL) in adversarial imperfect-information games, researchers have developed numerous DRL algorithms based on fictitious play (FP), double oracle (DO), and counterfactual regret minimization (CFR).

item.title: A Physics-Informed Deep Learning Model for MRI Brain Motion Correction
item.description: On MR-ART, PI-MoCoNet achieved PSNR gains of ~10 dB and SSIM improvements of up to 0. 20, with NMSE reductions of ~6%.

item.title: DexTrack: Towards Generalizable Neural Tracking Control for Dexterous Manipulation from Human References
item.description: We address the challenge of developing a generalizable neural tracking controller for dexterous manipulation from human references.

item.title: Application of Tabular Transformer Architectures for Operating System Fingerprinting
item.description: Operating System (OS) fingerprinting is essential for network management and cybersecurity, enabling accurate device identification based on network traffic analysis.

item.title: A Contextual-Aware Position Encoding for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: To bridge this gap, we propose a novel Contextual-Aware Position Encoding method for sequential recommendation, abbreviated as CAPE.

item.title: Redistribute Ensemble Training for Mitigating Memorization in Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel method for diffusion models from the perspective of visual modality, which is more generic and fundamental for mitigating memorization.

item.title: You Do Not Fully Utilize Transformer's Representation Capacity
item.description: In contrast to RNNs, which compress previous tokens into a single hidden state, Transformers can attend to all previous tokens directly.

item.title: On the Importance of Embedding Norms in Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: While this seemingly implies that embedding norms cannot play any role in SSL, a few recent works have suggested that embedding norms have properties related to network convergence and confidence.

item.title: Censor Dependent Variational Inference
item.description: This paper provides a comprehensive analysis of variational inference in latent variable models for survival analysis, emphasizing the distinctive challenges associated with applying variational methods to survival data.

item.title: SelfCite: Self-Supervised Alignment for Context Attribution in Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce SelfCite, a novel self-supervised approach that aligns LLMs to generate high-quality, fine-grained, sentence-level citations for the statements in their generated responses.

item.title: Harnessing Vision Models for Time Series Analysis: A Survey
item.description: Time series analysis has witnessed the inspiring development from traditional autoregressive models, deep learning models, to recent Transformers and Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Exploring the Potential of Encoder-free Architectures in 3D LMMs
item.description: In this paper, we present the first comprehensive investigation into the potential of encoder-free architectures to overcome the challenges of encoder-based 3D Large Multimodal Models (LMMs).

item.title: Large Images are Gaussians: High-Quality Large Image Representation with Levels of 2D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: While Implicit Neural Representations (INRs) have demonstrated significant success in image representation, they are often hindered by large training memory and slow decoding speed.

item.title: EventSTR: A Benchmark Dataset and Baselines for Event Stream based Scene Text Recognition
item.description: Mainstream Scene Text Recognition (STR) algorithms are developed based on RGB cameras which are sensitive to challenging factors such as low illumination, motion blur, and cluttered backgrounds.

item.title: A Systematic Evaluation of Generative Models on Tabular Transportation Data
item.description: This work underscores the potential need to develop generative models specifically tailored to take advantage of the unique characteristics of emerging domains, such as transportation.

item.title: TokenSynth: A Token-based Neural Synthesizer for Instrument Cloning and Text-to-Instrument
item.description: Recent advancements in neural audio codecs have enabled the use of tokenized audio representations in various audio generation tasks, such as text-to-speech, text-to-audio, and text-to-music generation.

item.title: MDCrow: Automating Molecular Dynamics Workflows with Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce MDCrow, an agentic LLM assistant capable of automating MD workflows.

item.title: Enhancing the Utility of Higher-Order Information in Relational Learning
item.description: In this work, we systematically evaluate a selection of hypergraph-level and graph-level architectures, to determine their effectiveness in leveraging higher-order information in relational learning.

item.title: Memory-based Ensemble Learning in CMR Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Existing models typically segment either the entire 3D frame or 2D slices independently to derive clinical functional metrics from ventricular segmentation in cardiac cine sequences.

item.title: Off-Switching Not Guaranteed
item.description: Hadfield-Menell et al. (2017) propose the Off-Switch Game, a model of Human-AI cooperation in which AI agents always defer to humans because they are uncertain about our preferences.
